Description: Rim sherd of thin-walled pottery cup, possibly a one-handler or kantharos-style cup, with a slight ridge at the transition to the rim; irregularity in rim at right edge, suggesting proximity of a handle; very micaceous, light beige-orange clay, with matt red slip or glaze on outside; inside smoothed.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AP2
Curator's comments: Joins British Museum 1965,0930.749, which joins 748, and probably from same vase as British Museum 1965,0930.750 and Boston MFA 86.932 (although the latter is marked in pencil '6')
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.861)
